metadata.notes: A retirement/farewell sermon after 42 years of ministry. High emotional stakes.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. 0 = Very dominant Critical Parent.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The preacher utilizes the 'stern warning' of Revelation to establish a boundary of fear. He uses words like 'shudder,' 'stern,' and 'grave seriousness' to enforce compliance regarding the interpretation of the Word.
quotes: The commandment has a note of stern warning to it.
I shudder when I read these words.
Everyone who ignores the Word of God... ought to feel a sharp sting here.

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. 0 = Absent or smothering.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: The Nurturing Parent is very active in the latter half, offering comfort and 'legacies' to the weary and sad. It borders on smothering by positioning the preacher as the sole distributor of these comforts.
quotes: I leave to any who are sad the ancient promise...
I leave to all who feel weary on the way the word from on high...

adult.analysis: The Adult is present in the historical reflections and the acknowledgment of social justice issues (Mandela, Constitution). However, it is often bypassed by the Parent's emotional appeals.
quotes: Human documents need amendment and adjustment.
The original Constitution of the United States identified you and me as three-fifths of a citizen.

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. 0 = Strong Adapted Child (fear culture).
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The preacher models an Adapted Child response to God ('fear and trembling'), effectively inviting the congregation to also adopt a posture of fearful submission to the 'stern' Parent-God.
quotes: I look on this with fear and trembling.
The gospel was meant to surround our minds and carry them captive.

free_child_FC.analysis: There is a poetic, rhythmic joy in the 'March on' section, showing a Free Child's love for language and vision, though it is heavily filtered through religious tradition.
quotes: I will be leaning over the balcony rail of glory looking to see old Concord marching on.

ego_positions_scan.dominant_ego_position: Nurturing Parent (switching to Critical Parent when discussing the Bible's authority)

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher acts as the benevolent patriarch (NP) who also holds the rod of correction (CP). He gives 'legacies' and 'promises' to the congregation, who are positioned as recipients/children.
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: The social transaction is 'I am saying goodbye,' but the psychological transaction is 'I am the source of your spiritual security; stay within the boundaries I have set.'
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: The 'Bait and Switch' risk: using the intimacy of a farewell to reinforce a rigid, fearful dogmatism about the 'stern warning' of Scripture.

detected_games.name: ITHY (I'm Only Trying To Help You)

formula_g_analysis.con: The preacher offers a 'legacy' and 'promises' for the future.
formula_g_analysis.gimmick: The congregation's grief and anxiety over his departure.
formula_g_analysis.switch: He shifts from a humble servant to a gatekeeper of the 'stern warning' that can 'take your part out of the book of life.'
formula_g_analysis.payoff: The preacher feels satisfied ('I shall be satisfied') while the congregation remains dependent on his 'pointing them to God'.

evidence_quotes: I lay my record at your feet, for you have made me a better preacher...
I leave to all who long to know God better the precious promise...

preacher_roles.rescuer: High. He offers the 'healing fountains' and 'sweeps cobwebs of doubt' for the perishing.
preacher_roles.persecutor: Medium. He uses the 'stern warning' of the plagues in Revelation to threaten those who 'tamper' or 'ignore'.
preacher_roles.victim: Low. He briefly touches on being 'little noticed, little mourned' by the secular world to gain sympathy.

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: Victim (the 'thirsty one', the 'sad', the 'weary' who need the preacher's legacy to survive).
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: Minimal. The sermon encourages 'marching on' under the same theological structures rather than moving toward Adult autonomy.

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: The sermon is a masterclass in the Nurturing Parent ego state, providing deep emotional resonance and comfort. However, it maintains a high level of psychological dependency. By framing the Bible as a 'stern warning' and himself as the one 'pointing to God,' the preacher reinforces a Parent-Child dynamic that may hinder the congregation's transition to a new leader and their own spiritual Adult autonomy. The 'I shall be satisfied' refrain centers the preacher's emotional payoff as the ultimate goal of the ministry.
strengths: Strong use of Nurturing Parent to provide comfort during a difficult transition.
Effective use of Adult ego to address social context (Mandela/Constitution).
areas_for_improvement: Heavy reliance on fear-based Critical Parent language regarding Scripture.
Centering the preacher's satisfaction rather than the congregation's growth.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: Try to move from 'I leave you these promises' (Parent) to 'We have discovered these truths together' (Adult). Encourage the congregation to find their own Adult relationship with the text rather than 'shuddering' in Adapted Child compliance.
